lessonSubtitleText: Test how well you know this story

answers: He heard that Jerusalem’s walls were still torn down
He wanted to move to another country

questions.text: What did Nehemiah ask the king to let him do?
At what time of day did Nehemiah inspect the walls, and why?
answers: At night, to keep his plans secret from enemies
At noon, so everyone could see

questions.text: How did Tobiah and Sanballat feel about the wall?
answers: They hated it and made fun of the workers
They hated it and knocked the wall down
They didn't care about the wall at all

questions.text: How else did Tobiah and Sanballat try to stop the work?
answers: They threatened to attack the workers by surprise
They offered them money to stop
They kept knocking the wall down
They sent foxes to attack the workers

questions.text: How did the people respond after their enemies’ threats?
How did Nehemiah encourage the people after they were threatened?
answers: He told them to remember that the Lord is great and powerful
He told them it was okay to quit

questions.text: How did Nehemiah keep his workers safe?
answers: Half worked while half stood guard, and workers carried swords in their belts
He told everyone to work faster

questions.text: How long did it take to rebuild the wall of Jerusalem?
